str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
A prolonged form of nun for emphasis; just now.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
From a compound of apo and archomai; a beginning of sacrifice, i.e. The first-fruit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From keimai; to put to sleep, i.e. to slumber; figuratively, to decease.
